Class WaterSpray

  • java.lang.Object
    • WaterSpray

  • public class WaterSpray
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a single spray of water, which the plane can shoot at the fires
    Version:
    5/13/19
    Author:
    Ashwini Suriyaprakash

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WaterSpray(double x, double y, double vx, double vy)
      Creates a WaterSpray object with given parameters, that has not been consumed by a fire

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act()
      Causes the WaterSpray to act based on its velocities
      void consume()
      Consumes the water spray (specifically, used when it hits the fire)

    • Constructor Detail

      • WaterSpray

        public WaterSpray(double x,
                  double y,
                  double vx,
                  double vy)
        Creates a WaterSpray object with given parameters, that has not been consumed by a fire
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the WaterSpray
        y - y coordinate of the WaterSpray
        vx - velocity in the x direction
        vy - velocity in the y direction
